Scilab function

NAME

    show_nodes - highlights a set of nodes

CALLING SEQUENCE

show_nodes(nodes,[sup])

PARAMETERS

    • nodes : row vector of node numbers
    • sup : string, superposition flag

DESCRIPTION

    show_nodes highlights the set of nodes nodes of the displayed graph in the current window. If the optional argument sup is equal to the string "sup" , the highlighting is superposed on the previous one.

    This function can also be called to unhighlight highlighted nodes by using the call show_nodes([]) . Note also that when a set of node is highlighted, the automatic highlight during mouse move is not performed. Calling show_nodes([]) restores the automatic highlight during mouse move.

EXAMPLES

    scigraph(graph=SCI+"/demos/metanet/mesh100.graph",..
 wdim=[500,500],wpdim=[500,500]);
for i=1:3:100,xpause(100000), show_nodes([i]); end;
for i=1:3:100, show_nodes([i],"sup"); end;
show_nodes([]);
